techmeme.title: Sources: Revolut has told staff it is launching a sale of up to $500M worth of existing shares at a $45B valuation; former employees are ineligible (Akila Quinio/Financial Times)
Character.AI told staff that investors will be bought out at a valuation of ~2.5x its $1B 2023 valuation, and it plans to adopt open-source models for products (The Information)
Character.AI co-founders Noam Shazeer and Daniel De Freitas, and some employees, are joining Google; Google has signed a non-exclusive agreement to use its tech (Ivan Mehta/TechCrunch)
The US DOJ sues TikTok, saying it collected children's data without parents' permission, knowingly let users under the age of 13 create accounts, and more (New York Times)
A look at Musk-backed America PAC's "Register to Vote" online campaign, which collects users' personal data in swing states, but does not help them register (Brian Schwartz/CNBC)
